since 31 December 2016  
[Seat](/wiki/Seat_\(legal_entity\) "Seat \(legal entity\)") | [Central Secretariat](/wiki/Secretariat_Building,_New_Delhi "Secretariat Building, New Delhi")  
Appointer | The [President of India](/wiki/President_of_India "President of India")

The **Chief of the Army Staff** is the commander and usually the highest-
ranking officer of the [Indian Army](/wiki/Indian_Army "Indian Army"). The
position is abbreviated as **COAS** in Indian Army, and usually held by a
[four-star officer](/wiki/Four-star_officer "Four-star officer") in the rank
of [General](/wiki/General "General").

The current COAS is [General](/wiki/General "General") [Bipin
Rawat](/wiki/Bipin_Rawat "Bipin Rawat"), who took office on 31 December 2016
following the retirement of [General](/wiki/General "General") [Dalbir
Singh](/wiki/Dalbir_Singh "Dalbir Singh").[1]

## Office of the Chief of the Army
Staff[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chief_of_the_Army_Staff_\(India\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Office of the Chief of the Army Staff")]

The office of the Chief of the Army Staff was created through _The Commanders-
In-Chief (Change in Designation) Act_ of the [Indian
Parliament](/wiki/Indian_Parliament "Indian Parliament") in 1955. It replaced
the erstwhile office of the **Commander-in-Chief, Army**.[2] The office is
based at [South Block](/wiki/South_Block "South Block") of the [Central
Secretariat](/wiki/Secretariat_Building,_New_Delhi "Secretariat Building, New
Delhi") at [Raisina Hill](/wiki/Raisina_Hill "Raisina Hill"), [New
Delhi](/wiki/New_Delhi "New Delhi").

Appointments to the office are made by the [President of
India](/wiki/President_of_India "President of India"). The COAS reaches
[superannuation](/wiki/Superannuation "Superannuation") upon three years in
the office or at the age of 62, whichever is earlier.
